official-title.#text: To amend the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to provide, because of problems relating to the operation of Exchanges, for a hardship exemption from the individual mandate for months of noncoverage, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Fairness In Failed Federal Exchange Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1311(d) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:d

header.#text: Waiver of individual mandate through application of hardship exemption
Application of hardship exemption in cases of noncoverage

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ) who is not covered by minimum essential coverage and who is eligible to enroll through an Exchange for coverage under a qualified health plan for a month—

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: with respect to the hardship exemption described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:d/p:4/sp:H
Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:e/p:5/sp:H

text.#text: in 2014 is deemed (for purposes of this Act and the amendments made by this Act) to have had a certification by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: under such paragraph with respect to such hardship exemption if the individual executes an attestation that the individual has been unable to enroll in such a plan through such Exchange for a month in such year.

text.#text: in a subsequent year is deemed (for such purposes) to have had a certification by the
